verbose_text: Upon Reelin binding to the receptors, ApoER2 and very-low-density lipoprotein receptor (VLDLR), Src family kinases (SFKs) become activated and phosphorylate the intracellular adaptor protein Dab1, thereby initiating a complex signaling cascade leading to correct neuronal positioning during the development of the neocortex, hippocampus, and cerebellum.
evidence: Src family kinases (SFKs) become activated and phosphorylate the intracellular adaptor protein Dab1
